Entries.Introduction: I don't know you. Why are you talking to me...?
Entries.JojaMart: %Shane's hard at work. He doesn't seem interested in talking.
Entries.Mon: I don't know you. Why are you talking to me?
Entries.Mon6: I learned a while ago that it's easier to shut new people out before they get to know me.#$e#A lot of people just turn out to be jackasses.
Entries.Mon8: Emily's a pretty good girl. She gives me beer and she listens. Not much else I need.#$e#You're pretty cool, too.
Entries.Tue8: Clint's a bit awkward. I don't know how Emily puts up with the obvious hots he's got for her.#$e#Or maybe she's just oblivious...$u
Entries.Tue10: It never would've worked out for me and Emily... for obvious reasons. I'm glad I have you.$l^Emily and I were always just friends. I'm glad that we kept it that way.$l
Entries.Wed4: Have I ever gotten really weird and vulnerable with you while I was drunk? I have the tendency to do that.$u#$e#Whatever I said, don't read into it.$u
Entries.Wed6: $d Joja#*sigh* ...Every day is the same. Stocking those horrible shelves, going to the saloon, tossing and turning all night.$s|I hated my job at JojaMart, but now that I'm unemployed I feel even worse.$s
Entries.Wed10: My counselor's been helping me out a lot with my thoughts of suicide. I think I'm moving past it.#$b#Alcohol is still a tough one, though.#$e#A lot of people don't get it. I can't just 'stop going' to the saloon.$s
Entries.Thu10: I have my ups and downs still. But lately, things seem to be a bit better.#$e#Like, today's good, right? You stopped to talk, for one thing.$h
Entries.Fri2: You're just not gonna leave me alone, are you? $s
Entries.Fri10: @, I appreciate you being there for me. But you realize that you're not gonna fix me, right?#$e#I'm just saying, what you see is what you get.#$e#Give it some thought. I don't want to hurt you.$s
Entries.Sat10: Oh man, I got really drunk before I went to bed last night.$s#$q 530/531/532 Sat_old#You must be disappointed in me.#$r 530 -250 Sat_530#Yeah! I thought you wanted to get clean!#$r 531 0 Sat_531#Recovery has its ups and downs.#$r 531 0 Sat_531#Sorry, I know it's hard for you.#$r 532 -50 Sat_532#No prob. You do you.
Entries.Sat_old: $p 530#Look, I'm doing my best. I'm sorry if I let you down sometimes.$s|But I appreciate that you're always around, no matter what.
Entries.Sat_530: ...#$b#Well clearly I'm not good enough for you.#$b#It's cool. Go hang out with someone else.
Entries.Sat_531: ...#$b#How are you such a good person? Don't you ever get mad about anything?$s#$e#Thanks, though.
Entries.Sat_532: ...#$b#Seriously, what the hell. Do you even care about what I do?$a
Entries.Sun2: You again? How many times do I have to tell you to leave me alone?$s
Entries.Sun4: Hmm... it's %time. Should I throw a frozen pizza in the microwave, or should I wait?$u
Entries.summer_Mon6: $d Joja#I think I'll spend a little extra time in Joja's back room freezer when it's hot like this.$u|Hmm... what can I do to pass the time today?
Entries.summer_Mon8: I think Emily's nice just for the sake of being nice. I don't need her pity, but...#$b#...I don't -not- need her company, either.$u
Entries.summer_Mon10: Jas and I played a pretty fun game yesterday. We made a little obstacle course outside.$h#$e#I know I haven't been a great influence on Jas, but you have to admit I have my moments.
Entries.summer_Tue8: $d Joja#My walk to work in the morning is nice during the summer. It's just so calm and not too hot yet.|Those chickens sure do get me up early. But at least the air's nice in the summer when the sun first comes up.
Entries.summer_Tue10: Maybe I fell for Emily a little bit, at one point or another, but...$s#$b#...you're different in that you actually seem to be serious about wanting something from me, too.$l
Entries.summer_Wed6: $d Joja#*sigh* ...Every day is the same. Stocking those horrible shelves, going to the saloon, tossing and turning all night.$s|I hated my job at JojaMart, but now that I'm unemployed I feel even worse.$s
Entries.summer_Wed8: Marnie and Jas have put up with a lot of my crap. I actually feel motivated to do my best for them.#$e#That's not something I've felt in a long time.
Entries.summer_Thu6: Looking forward to gridball season?#$e#Sometimes it's fun to watch the junior league in the off-season, too. Tickets are cheaper.
Entries.summer_Thu8: Man, the chickens won't stay out of trouble lately. Breaking stuff... Getting stuck in stuff...#$b#Hah, at least they need me for something.$h
Entries.summer_Thu10: When your two best friends die on the same exact day, it really kind of messes you up.$s#$e#I had problems before they died, but that's really still the worst of it.
Entries.summer_Fri4: What a hot day. I could really use a cold one.#$e#You in?
Entries.summer_Fri6: I saw some old classmates' photos online.$s#$e#The most revolting ones are of the people who can't take a photo without their freakin' baby in the shot.
Entries.summer_Fri8: Seeing people who have it all... the money, the house, the honor-student kids...#$b#...it almost seems even more depressing than what I've got.#$e#Hey there, sport! Congrats on another straight-A report card! Let's get ice cream!$10#$b#Gross.$u
Entries.summer_Fri10: Out of a million people, I bet you're the only one who wouldn't have bailed on me by this point.#$e#Hey, I don't take these things for granted.
Entries.summer_Sun6: Looks like I'm gettin' a little gut. Oh boy. Soon I'll be the guy who has it all!$u
Entries.summer_Sun8: $d Joja#Back to work for another week tomorrow. Yayyy...$s|I kind of miss having actual weekends, like I used to. But I guess that's the tradeoff for being a full-time chicken man, now.
Entries.summer_Sun10: @, one thing you should probably know is that I'm technically Jas's godfather.$s#$e#Marnie's really the one who's been raising her, though. I really screwed that one up.$s
Entries.fall_Mon6: I saw some old classmates' photos online.$s#$e#The most revolting ones are of the people who can't take a photo without their freakin' baby in the shot.
Entries.fall_Mon8: I missed the gridball game last night. Whatevs. It's better live, anyway.
Entries.fall_Mon10: Do you ever feel like the whole world is scrutinizing you like some disgusting insect?
Entries.fall_Tue8: Well, at least Clint's life is crappier than mine. Guy lives alone.#$e#Sorry, yeah, that was a crappy thing to say.$s
Entries.fall_Tue10: It's strange how I don't ever seem to get bored with seeing you, @.#$e#That's never happened for me before.$l
Entries.fall_Wed6: $d Joja#*sigh* ...Every day is the same. Stocking those horrible shelves, going to the saloon, tossing and turning all night.$s|I hated my job at JojaMart, but now that I'm unemployed I feel even worse.$s
Entries.fall_Wed8: I guess I've grown attached to Marnie and Jas. We're a ragtag bunch but it kind of feels like a weird family.#$e#I never really had much of a family as a kid.$s
Entries.fall_Thu6: Hey @.#$e#So, are you drinking tonight? It's cool if you want to join me.
Entries.fall_Thu8: You like talking to me? I guess I believe you... maybe you're as weird as I am.$h
Entries.fall_Thu10: I have my ups and downs still. But lately, things seem to be a bit better.#$e#Like, today's good, right? You stopped to talk, for one thing.$h
Entries.fall_Fri4: $d Joja#That guy Sam? Yeah, I work with him. Don't really talk to him much, though.|That guy Sam? Yeah, we worked together. Never really talked to him much, though.
Entries.fall_Fri8: I'll definitely be going to the saloon tonight. What else is there to do?
Entries.fall_Fri10: @, I appreciate you being there for me. But you realize that you're not gonna fix me, right?#$e#I'm just saying, what you see is what you get.#$e#Give it some thought. I don't want to hurt you.$s
Entries.fall_Sun6: ...I think I might be gaining weight.$s
Entries.fall_Sun8: If I watch more TV maybe I can forget about life. That would be relaxing.$u
Entries.fall_Sun10: A new chick hatched on our farm last night. It's been a good day so far.$h
Entries.winter_Mon8: I don't get how someone like Emily is so content with her life.#$e#I couldn't put up with her job and her life if I were in her shoes.#$e#And I probably wouldn't hang out with guys like me, either.$s
Entries.winter_Mon10: When your two best friends die on the same exact day, it really kind of messes you up.$s#$e#I had problems before they died, but that's really still the worst of it.
Entries.winter_Tue4: Poor little mother cluckers are stuck inside all winter long. Gotta take good care of them.#$e#You got that I meant chickens, right?$u
Entries.winter_Tue8: Do chickens have it better or worse than humans? Hmm...$u#$e#Worse, I'd say.#$b#Unless they're free-range chickens. Then... I don't know.
Entries.winter_Tue10: My counselor's been helping me out a lot with my thoughts of suicide.#$b#Alcohol is still a tough one, though.#$e#A lot of people don't get it. I can't just 'stop going' to the saloon.$s
Entries.winter_Wed6: $d Joja#*sigh* ...Every day is the same. Stocking those horrible shelves, going to the saloon, tossing and turning all night.$s|I hated my job at JojaMart, but now that I'm unemployed I feel even worse.$s
Entries.winter_Wed8: I try to do my best for Jas. She says she has some good memories with me already.#$e#I don't remember some of the ones she mentions, though.$s
Entries.winter_Thu6: Kind of a crappy day today...$s#$e#So what's the drunkest you've ever been?
Entries.winter_Thu8: You like talking to me? I guess I believe you... maybe you're as weird as I am.$h
Entries.winter_Thu10: I'll say... I had you completely wrong.#$b#First time I saw you, I thought you'd be an absolute tool. I'm glad I was wrong.$h
Entries.winter_Fri6: I'll definitely be going to the saloon tonight. What else is there to do?
Entries.winter_Fri8: Seeing people who have it all... the money, the house, the honor-student kids...#$b#...it almost seems even more depressing than what I've got.#$e#Hey there, sport! Congrats on another straight-A report card! Let's get ice cream!$10#$b#Gross.$u
Entries.winter_Fri10: $d Joja#The thought of getting to see you is what gets me through the day. Are we hanging out tonight?|Hey, I hope you're staying warm. I've got an old coat you can borrow if you need it.
Entries.winter_Sun6: It's been an interesting gridball season.#$e#Or so I hear. I've missed a ton of the games.
Entries.winter_Sun8: What's it like for those functional alcoholic millionaires? Like, the CEOs who always have half a minibar behind their desk?#$b#Do they just stay plastered all day and get paid for it? 'Cause if so, sign me up.#$e#Looks like I missed my calling.
Entries.winter_Sun10: What you have to understand, @, is that when I do my best, it looks a lot worse than what other people do.$s#$e#I just thought you should know that.
Entries.winter_28: Another year gone? Man.$u#$e#Take a wild guess what I'm doing all evening.
Entries.spring_1_2: Buh, my head.$s#$e#Can I just sleep through this whole year?$s
Entries.winter_28_2: Another year gone? Man.$u#$e#Take a wild guess what I'm doing all evening.

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: I hope Jas and Marnie are doing alright without me.#$e#I'm not too worried... Jas is old enough now to take care of the animals on her own.
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#Do me a favor... when I pass away, use my dust to fertilize some corn for the hens.#My knees are kind of stiff today. Does that ever happen to you, or is that just me?$s
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: #$c .5#Here... take this.[346 174 303 305 215] I bought some of those a while ago and they're almost expired...#Here, take this for later. [346 346 303] Just a little reminder not to work too hard when you can afford to be lazy.
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#Buhh... I don't feel like being productive today.#...Alright. Screw it. I'm dipping my pizza in ranch dressing today.$u
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#Well, should I do something useful today?... or just nap forever?#I was so dedicated last night to doing some sit-ups today. But this rain is really killing my motivation.
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: Hmm... seems like a good night to microwave a few pizza rolls.#$e#Some people like to cook them in the oven, but it just takes too long for me. Plus I like that squishy texture.$h
Entries.patio_Shane: #$c .5#Charlie's doing well.$8#If Charlie's in a good mood, I'm in a good mood, too.$8
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#The tip-tappa-tip of the rain takes me to a different time... a different place.#I hope Charlie's not scared out there.$u
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#I guess... if I had some pants I might've gone outside today... but, nah.#What if we just let Charlie live inside? It's not like there'd be that big a mess...$u
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#I like gloomy weather, but I feel kinda bad for the hens.#I still can't believe how you spend all that time outside when it rains, just like it's no big deal.
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#Tip-tappa-tip-tappa-tip... I'm starting to feel thirsty.$6#Do we have any homemade brews? Guess I'm feelin'... fancy tonight.
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#Buh... sometimes life feels like a slow, gray blur... know what I mean?#Here's to the end of another pointless day. Hey, not that that has to be a horrible thing.
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: #$c .5#Hey. Take this... I put a bit too much in the microwave. [195 215 206]Sorry if it's squishy.#Open your mouth. And close your eyes. And you'll get... a big surpriiiise. [195 215 206]
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#You know what? I think I've lost some weight since moving in with you.$6#Does it ever annoy you, that I'm not as peppy as a stereotypical dream husband?
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#*smooch*... Mmm, it tastes like someone's been nibbling on pizza rolls.$6#Hey, don't brush your hair. You're looking hot this morning.
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#I may keep to myself a lot, and I may seem unhappy sometimes... but I do appreciate all the work you do. I'm a lucky guy.$6#Give me something positive to focus on. I know it should feel like a good morning; I just need some help getting there.
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#I'm just gonna have a couple more beers before closing my eyes for the night.#I took a nap while you were out. I hope that doesn't screw up my sleep cycle.
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: If... If only... ah, I was just thinking back on the glory days, when I played gridball on the varsity team.$6#$b#Now I'm old and weak, though...
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#Ughh... *gurgle*... I feel a little bloated... oof... too much Joja all-purpose dipping sauce.#Hey, I was good today. I wanted to finish the bag of Carbo Cones, but I held off.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#Buh... I wish I was six inches taller and a whole lot smarter... But you like me for who I am? I still have a hard time understanding that...#Hey. Want to... go to bed when I do?$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#I spent all day watching TV and now my legs feel like soft dough. Guess I'll have to take it easy until tomorrow.#Maybe I should drink something to help me sleep. Not a good solution, but it'd beat staying up all night.
Entries.Outdoor_0: I didn't sleep well last night so I'm hoping this fresh air will get the juices flowing.#$e#What juices, you ask? Heh... you're weird.$h
Entries.Outdoor_1: Sometimes I stop and realize that I'm nothing more than a bag of juicy, squishy flesh.#$e#But hey... that's just fine... what's life, anyway?$h
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#When I stop and think about it... I'm in a good place. My life is pretty nice.$6#I can't really think of a better place to be right now, than here. Gotta keep things in perspective, right?$6
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#Ooohh... my tongue is swollen from eating too many pepper poppers.$s#Dang. I didn't realize how stagnant the air in my lungs was till I got out here.
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#Hey. You were sleeping like a baby so I slipped out of bed and went for a morning walk around the farm. Everything looks fine.#I don't know why, but I'm just feeling pretty good this morning. I must've slept well.$h
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#It's weird, when I was younger I swore I'd never have a kid. I wonder what happened to me?$6#I want to make sure I don't screw things up for %kid1. Just... have some patience with me.
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#Let's make sure to give this kid lots of eggs... Baby's gotta grow those legs!#I want to give %kid1 the best childhood ever. I've got to make up for at least some of my screw-ups of the past.
Entries.OneKid_3: Papa Shane reporting for duty...$6#$e#Buh... I've become corny in my old age.
Entries.TwoKids_0: #$c .5#Well, if the kids stop behaving themselves today, I can always bust out some tunes for a spontaneous dance party.#I already fed the kids two bowls of pizza puffs cereal. They'll be full for a while.
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#I'll be honest... two kids is enough for me.#Oh my god, how does anyone ever raise more than two kids? I'm so exhausted.$s
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#Whew... I hope the kids wind up with more of your traits than mine.#Ugh... %kid2 is being a little brat today. Must've gotten that from me...
Entries.TwoKids_3: *Sigh*... If only we could send the kids off to Joja work-camp for a season...#$e#I'm just kidding.$h
Entries.funLeave_Shane: #$c .5#I'm going to go out today, alright?#Time for me to get a change of scenery or the walls'll close in. I'll be back later today.
Entries.funReturn_Shane: #$c .5#Sorry if I'm sweaty... That was quite a walk... Buh, I'm out of shape.$6#Yeah, I had a good time going out. Don't worry, though. I was good.
Entries.spring_2: It was awesome yesterday, seeing the chickens get outside for the first time in a while.$h
Entries.spring_14: Buh, I think I'm on post egg festival withdrawal. Just not a lot to look forward to for a while.$s#$e#Don't worry, I'll be alright in the long run. This always happens to me.
Entries.spring_19: Eventually, everyone gets tired of everything.#$b#Ha, am I just ahead of my time, or something?$h
Entries.spring_27: I'll admit I did not... drink in moderation the other night.$s#$b#But still, I'm a helluva lot better off than I was before I met you. I just hope that makes sense from your perspective.#$e#I mean, you haven't discovered me passed out cold any time lately, right?
Entries.summer_2: We're growing hot peppers this summer, right?
Entries.summer_4: Man, I miss Jas. Today's her birthday, too.#$e#I knew there was something I was forgetting.
Entries.summer_12: Ha, it was awesome yesterday, seeing Emily do her thing on the dance floor. Glad she's as well as ever.$h
Entries.summer_16: ...Another year's gone by since I 'adopted' Jas. And then promptly screwed it all up.$s#$e#Things are turning out alright for her. No thanks to me.$s#$e#I guess things would've been different if it happened now. With you around, I'm a lot more stable than I used to be, believe it or not.
Entries.summer_17: How do people like you and Marnie just keep it together all the time? I don't even know where I'd be if Marnie hadn't taken in Jas... and me.$s#$e#Well, and then you came along.$l
Entries.fall_3: I suddenly felt like cooking, so I made omelets. Here you go. [195]#$e#Just don't ask me to do much real cooking besides this. Seriously. You'd regret it more than I would.$h
Entries.fall_7: Oh that's right. Gridball season just started. I'll have to check if there are any good games coming up.
Entries.fall_10: Today's a good day for a playthrough of Turbo 2. Or maybe Paths of Fury 2.#$b#Hm. ...Or maybe both.$u
Entries.fall_12: I was walking around yesterday, looking all over the farm. It's really something else, isn't it?#$e#YOU'RE really something else, I mean.$h
Entries.fall_23: We live for sleep. Everything we do is about it. We work, so we get tired, so we can sleep.#$b#We eat, so we're not hungry, so we can sleep. We do creative things so we feel fulfilled, and then we sleep.#$b#Are we all just unknowingly training to get more comfortable with our inevitable deaths?$u
Entries.winter_1: Any big plans this winter? I'll probably end up watching a lot of TV and just hanging out around the house.
Entries.winter_28: Well, another year gone by... I look a little older...$6#$b#...but you look good as ever.
